intro: Astragalus francisquitensis var. lagunensis, commonly known as the Lagunense Milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and supports local pollinator populations.
